check:
Have the firewall admin verify telnet is not enabled on the firewall and is not listening on port 23.

If telnet is enabled on the firewall or the firewall is listening on port 23, this is a finding.
description: Telnet is an unencrypted service which can be easily exploited, especially when used over a public network such as the internet. With telnet enabled on the firewall, an attacker may be able to send spoofed packets through the firewall and consume the firewall’s memory, causing a denial of service on the device. Telnet service is vulnerable to many exploits which can compromise the network device if enabled.

device.finding 1: Nipper Studio determined that telnet was enabled on PA-200

fix: Disable telnet and verify the firewall is not listening to port 23.
summary: The firewall must not be listening for telnet service.
title: Firewall is listening for telnet service.
